column4: anyone familiar with the whole pulseaudio / jack compatibiltiy issue?  Can they co-exist?
I have never gotten pulseaudio to work with jack. Better of using ALSA or OSS.
So just uninstall pulseaudio - that's what I figured.  I only installed it to record audio reference songs from YouTube for my guitar/Ardour sessions
It introduced a ton of latency
I guess there is another way to record YouTube video with fflmgr or something like that
Yeah. I'm not a big fan of pa. pavucontrol is the best thing for it.
I really don't need it.  Why do people like /need pusleaudio - it must serve some nitche
Yea, especially when I don't have a lot of time to practice / play.
pulseaudio - zapped.  gone.  uninstalled.  I hope it didn't leave anything troublesome behind
Lemme check and see what I have running.
may go ProTools soon with M-Box or Edirol Firewire and stay with Ardour/Reaper
but I really like Ardour, so I may go with Edirol unit - the seem to work well with Ubuntu
spend money saved on a SM57
I couldn't get anything to work correctly in Vista. $8000 of software/hardware and only half of it would even load!!!
lmms and Reaper are very good too
Also looking at an M-Audio Oxygen 61 mini controller/keyboard.  I think I need slide controls for channels
but someone told me "knob" type controllers are cool - like the Apogee Duet
